channel.title: 漢黨 Han Party
channel.description: Recent content on 漢黨 Han Party

item.title: Chinese and Han
item.description: Huaxia and Han are the names of the same name and different times. China is also called “summer” and “summer” and “China”. China is interlinked with Xia, “Xia” is also called “Hua”. Han: it originally refers to the river of heaven and the river of the universe. The poem says, “there is Han in heaven, and there is light in prison.”. In the old Han Dynasty, it was called Han people, and got its name because of the Han Dynasty.

item.title: Yellow calendar
item.description: The Yellow calendar, that is, the Yellow Emperor calendar, is a traditional Chinese calendar. It is the ancient six calendars with the Xia calendar, Yin calendar, Zhou calendar, Lu calendar and Zhuanxu calendar. According to a large number of historical records, it was made after Emperor Huang broke Chiyou. It is said that the calendar year began from the day when the yellow emperor ascended the throne. Xuanyuan Yellow Emperor was the cultural ancestor of Huayi, and was the same ancestor of Huayi with Shennong Yan Emperor, Dongyi people and Chiyou of Miao people (there are three ancestral halls of China in Zhuolu, Hebei).

item.title: Xiaosui
item.description: Today’s Xiaosui is on the 23rd day of the twelfth lunar month. At this point, every household is hygienic and has a good year’s taste. After Xiaosui, it’s new year. Xiaosui is a dress rehearsal on the first day of the lunar calendar. It’s a beautiful wish for Chinese people to say goodbye to the old and welcome the new. There are kitchen king, window decoration, Spring Festival couplets, dust cleaning, marriage, eating sesame candy and dumplings in the small age customs.

item.title: Communication

item.title: About Han Party
item.description: Han Party, is the Party of the han people, is to make Chinese welfare. Study the Han culture, carry forward the Han civilization, rejuvenation of China, the Great Han Dynasty. This is the highest pursuit of the Han Party. More details: official website of HanParty
